title: Dianne Buswell 'to perform on Strictly' despite rushed to hospital
text:
Dianne Buswell ‘to perform on Strictly’ despite being rushed to hospital (Picture: WireImage)

Dianne Buswell will perform on tonight’s episode of Strictly Come Dancing despite being rushed to hospital.

It was recently reported that the 30-year-old landed on her head after an eight-foot drop when she was trying out a lift with her celebrity partner, Dev Griffin.

However, even though it was feared she would suffer from a concussion, it turns out the professional dancer is fighting fit and excited for her upcoming routine.

When taking part in an Instagram Q&A, the star was asked what her favourite dance of the show was so far.

She said: ‘I think tomorrow night’s one. It’s going to be so much fun.’

She is looking forward to her routine (Picture: PA)

A source also told The Mirror: ‘There was an incident and Dianne went to get checked over. She’s absolutely fine and performing tomorrow night.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

News broke of her accident late on Friday night, where The Sun claimed Dev was ‘doubled over in panic’ after the dancer came crashing to the floor.

An insider said: ‘Dev let her slip from his grasp and Dianne fell and landed on her head. It couldn’t have been worse. It was horrible to watch Dianne lying prostrate on the floor…

‘Dev… was praying that there was no serious damage — the worst-case scenario was that she had some internal head injuries.’

The star is said to have been discharged with whiplash (Picture: Getty Images)

They added: ‘She plunged a long way and he couldn’t help but panic about what he’d done. Dev insisted on going to hospital and looked in total shock.’

But it turns out there was no damage, and Dianne was discharged with whiplash.

Dianne and Dev have been one of the frontrunners of the competition, earning a total score of 49 points across the first two live shows.

It isn’t the only accident to have hit the competition this year, with Jamie Laing forced to pull out after injuring his foot.

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday on BBC One at 7.10pm. Metro.co.uk have reached out to Dianne’s reps for further comment.

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.

description: Strictly Come Dancing's Dianne Buswell to perform 'favourite dance so far' despite being rushed to hospital.
